alert.note: Alert for Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 16 at 6:08AM CDT until September 16 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN BORDEN, NORTHEASTERN GLASSCOCK, EASTERN HOWARD, MITCHELL AND SOUTHERN SCURRY COUNTIES... At 608 AM CDT, the public reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Big Spring, Colorado City, Garden City, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Lake Colorado City State Park, Lake Colorado City, Sand Springs, Champion Creek Reservoir, Colorado City Airport, Inadale, Westbrook, Cuthbert, Vincent, Buford and Big Spring Country Club. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
